summary: SummaryFormulated for dry and combination skin, Hanskin's Pore Cleansing Balm AHA purifies pores, replenishes moisture and removes makeup in a single step.
details: DetailsBenefitsThoroughly removes makeup, including waterproof makeupA blend of nourishing oils softens and maintains skin health and hydrationAHAs like lactic and glycolic acid gently exfoliate dead skin and pore impuritiesSolid balm texture makes it mess-free, spill-proof and travel-friendlyGreat for dry and combination skin typesKey IngredientsLactic Acid: An AHA that dissolves dead skin cells while restoring skin moistureGlycolic Acid: An AHA that evens out skin texture and helps keep pores clearSunflower Seed Oil: Packed with Vitamin E for anti-aging benefitsJojoba Oil: A plant-based oil that improves skin texture and hydrationFormulated WithoutParabensDyesArtificial FragrancesAlcoholItem 2550230How To UseUse it as the first step in your double cleansing routine. Warm a small scoop of the cleansing balm between dry palms and massage over dry skin. Wet your hands with a little water and massage the face to emulsify the oil. Rinse well with warm water and pat dry. Follow with a water-based cleanser.Precautions: For external use only. Do not get into eyes.IngredientsMineral Oil, Ethylhexyl Stearate, Carthamus Tinctorius (Safflower) Seed Oil, PEG-20 Glyceryl Triisostearate, Cocos Nucifera (Coconut) Oil, Polyethylene, C13-15 Alkane, Olea Europaea (Olive) Fruit Oil, PEG-10 Isostearate, Trihydroxystearin, Citrus Aurantium Dulcis (Orange) Peel Oil, Lavandula Angustifolia (Lavender) Oil, Tocopheryl Acetate, Citrus Aurantium Bergamia (Bergamot) Fruit Oil, Water, Camellia Japonica Seed Oil, Prunus Armeniaca (Apricot) Kernel Oil, Simmondsia Chinensis (Jojoba) Seed Oil, Helianthus Annuus (Sunflower) Seed Oil, Moringa Oleifera Seed Oil, Ethyl Macadamiate, Glycerin, Tocopherol, Sodium PCA, Citric Acid, Lactic Acid, Tartaric Acid, Glycolic Acid, Malic Acid.Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: Use it as the first step in your double cleansing routine. Warm a small scoop of the cleansing balm between dry palms and massage over dry skin. Wet your hands with a little water and massage the face to emulsify the oil. Rinse well with warm water and pat dry. Follow with a water-based cleanser.Precautions: For external use only. Do not get into eyes.

reviews.headline: Got it during 21 days sale and I won't repurchase
reviews.comments: This doesn't rinse off easy and left a white film. I prefer the the other actual liquid oil cleanser or the Elemis Cleansing Balm over this.

reviews.headline: Sweet Mary and Joseph
reviews.comments: I'm thanking the skincare gods for Hanksin's AHA cleansing balm. The lemon smell is subtle for those of you dubious of scents. The biggest thing for me is the price point. There are so many cleansing balms that are double the price or more and do the exact same thing (sometimes they aren't as good!) A little goes a LONG way, and it takes off all my make up no problem (and sometimes I can go a lil ham on eye makeup). For those of you moping about double cleansing, look up the benefits of double cleansing! Since I have dry skin, I only use micellar water in the morning, so double cleansing is safe for my skin at night. The biggest setback is cleansing balms are messy, but thats kind of just the nature of the beast. Go ahead darlin', take a chance!

reviews.headline: Best cleansing balm I've used!
reviews.comments: This cleansing balm is amazing and leaves your skin feeling so soft! Eye makeup will come off as long as you emulsify the product. It is not often that I use a cleanser and it doesn't feel dry and tight afterwards. I have used other cleansing balms/oils but they don't compare. I highly recommend!

reviews.headline: Great Cleansing Balm
reviews.comments: I love thus product and the way my skin feels after using.  It melts my eye makeup for easy removal.  Let me say that no, it doesn't COMPLETELY remove my eye makeup, but what cleanser does?  I do have some residual that needs to be removed with a minimum of  eyemake remover. A little of this balm goes a long way. One of my favorite products for my 60+ years skin!

reviews.headline: DOUBLE CLEANSE
reviews.comments: A balm or oil cleanser is meant to be part of a DOUBLE CLEANSE!!!! Do not use this product and nothing else then write a bad review stating the product left a film on your face. Its not soap! This breaks down makeup and oils and spf, you then have to use a 2nd cleanser to clean your face!!!! Stop leaving bad reviews on products you do not know how to use!!!!!

reviews.headline: The best balm I've ever used
reviews.comments: I LOVE THIS. Its SO similar to precleanse dermalogica. It doesnt leave a residue. Little goes a long way, gets the makeup off perfectly. More of a balm but breaks down to an oil, its not thick. Makes my skin feels wonderful. I will buy this a million times and recommend this to anyone

reviews.headline: My new favorite cleansing balm
reviews.comments: I love oil based facial cleansers or balms to remove makeup and give me a very moisturized feeling cleanse- this one is my new fav!! It smells amazing, removes all makeup and residue and leaves my skin feeling super soft and glowy.

reviews.headline: First time user!
reviews.comments: I have been using this product for only 2 weeks.  I have never tried this product before.  I'm a cpap user so I cannot use moisturizer @ night, any longer!  I was hoping this produce would give me moisture @ night & not interfere with my mask seal.  It WORKS!  I'm so happy with this product.

reviews.headline: Love it!
reviews.comments: This balm works well taking off my makeup.  It is moisturizing and leaves my skin feeling clean and soft.  I definitely would purchase this product again.

reviews.headline: A must
reviews.comments: Absolutely love this. It melts the make up off without any aggressive cleaning.

reviews.headline: absolutely love this!
reviews.comments: this is such a yummy cleanser.  I love the texture,  the smell and it brings a scoop.  Will definitely buy again.

reviews.headline: I love this cleansing balm
reviews.comments: I have been using a different cleansing oil, but I tried this because it was on sale. I love the way my skin feels afterwards. Clean without drying out my skin.

reviews.headline: nope
reviews.comments: leaves a layer of stiffness on the skin. doesn't remove make up either.

reviews.headline: Best oil cleanser I've tried
reviews.comments: I usually have a problem with oil based cleasers causing break out however this product does not do thay at all. Very creamy and nice consistency, lathers into skin very well, and smells great. Makes my skin feel fresh and revived especially after a long day of wearing a full face. Love this oil cleanser and would definitely reccomend it to sensitive skin!

reviews.headline: Feeling balmy
reviews.comments: Ive tries a few make up removing balms and this is the best so far!  Its a little more expensive than Elf or Cerave brand, but you get more product and it works better!  The scent is light and refreshing.  I will be buying again!

reviews.headline: Was skeptical, but it's amazing!
reviews.comments: I thought it was super strange that an "oil" would help clean the oil from my pores, but it does and it's amazing! I got the bomb because I figured it would be easier to travel with, and I couldn't be more pleased. I've already recommended this to several people, and they too have been impressed.

reviews.headline: Ahmazzing!!
reviews.comments: I love this cleaning balm.  a little goes a long way, smells so good,  really cleanses off all make up and gets skin ready to wash with your favorite cleanser.

reviews.headline: Great facial cleanser
reviews.comments: Great balm cleanser! I would buy this product again.

reviews.headline: One of the best cleansing balm
reviews.comments: So nice for my combination skin. I like it almost as much as the Then I Met You cleansing balm from Soko glam. Better price and clean formula. It does have a mild citrus scent, which would normally bother me, but somehow I don't mind it at all.  Very good cleansing balm and I think I am ready to try other products from this brand.

reviews.headline: No Residue, Good Makeup Removal
reviews.comments:
I am currently on Acutane, so I was looking for an oil or balm cleanser for makeup removal before bed (as opposed to a scrub or foaming cleanser.) I wanted something that wouldn't take away the little oil that I have left and make my skin too dry. I am very satisfied with this product for several reasons: 
1. It actually removes foundation. I use a gentle toner after cleansing, and there is very little leftover makeup on the cotton pad. 
2. It is gentle and moisturizing. 
3. It is the right price for the amount of product that you get. 
4. Despite being a balm cleanser, you actually get a good lather when you add water. 
5. It doesn't make me breakout.

faceoff_positive.comments:
I have extremely dry sensitive skin. I also wear makeup everyday to work and it is on my skin for at least 11 hours. Plus, I live in the city....lots of smog and stuff. So, taking care of my skin is important. I picked this up when it first launched, the claims were intriguing.
I have been using it consistently now for 2 weeks and my skin looks better than it has in a very long time! I am hydrated, the texture is much smoother and I just look healthy and beautiful. I have not noticed a decrease in wrinkles, ( I am 54), but I truly was not expecting too. My pores have not disappeared but they have become smaller in size. 
The product itself is a balm. It comes with a tiny spatula, which I like. You pick up a small amount, warm it up on your fingers than apply to face. It smells clean and like oranges. If you are sensitive to scents you might want to steer clear or test it out first. The fun part is when you activate the balm with warm water. You place some water on your face and the product turns a milky white. And it just feels so nice. 
After rinsing and patting dry you can add your favorite moisturizer but honestly I have not needed to. 
Does it remove all makeup? Yes. I have been putting it through the paces. I have not removed any makeup with wipes before using this product and it has taken everything off;mascara, lippies, blush, bronzer, foundation....all of it. 
I highly recommend this product and will definitely be repurchasing.
faceoff_positive.headline: This stuff is amazing!!

faceoff_negative.comments: I've tried a lot of cleansing oils and balms and I really do like the way this feels on the skin as well as how it has lactic acid in it, but it doesn't not remove eye makeup well. I was not even wearing waterproof eye makeup or anything but it didn't remove my mascara or eyeliner. So I'm bummed about that and I was just using drugstore products too. Other than that it's great!
faceoff_negative.headline: Love the way it feels - doesn't remove eye makeup very well
